eu.stratosphere.nephele.jobgraph

Class AbstractJobVertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.stratosphere.nephele.jobgraph.AbstractJobVertex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.esotericsoftware.kryo.KryoSerializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractJobInputVertex, AbstractJobOutputVertex, JobTaskVertex

    public abstract class AbstractJobVertex
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.esotericsoftware.kryo.KryoSerializable
    An abstract base class for a job vertex in Nephele.
    Author:
    warneke

    • Method Detail

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex,
                      int indexOfOutputGate,
                      int indexOfInputGate)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        indexOfOutputGate - index of the producing task's output gate to be used, -1 will determine the next free index number
        indexOfInputGate - index of the consuming task's input gate to be used, -1 will determine the next free index number
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex,
                      ChannelType channelType,
                      CompressionLevel compressionLevel)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        channelType - the channel type the two vertices should be connected by at runtime
        compressionLevel - the compression level the corresponding channel should have at runtime
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex,
                      ChannelType channelType,
                      CompressionLevel compressionLevel,
                      DistributionPattern distributionPattern)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        channelType - the channel type the two vertices should be connected by at runtime
        compressionLevel - the compression level the corresponding channel should have at runtime
        distributionPattern - the distribution patter according to which the subtasks of the connected vertices shall be connected
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex,
                      ChannelType channelType,
                      CompressionLevel compressionLevel,
                      DistributionPattern distributionPattern,
                      boolean allowSpanningRecords)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        channelType - the channel type the two vertices should be connected by at runtime
        compressionLevel - the compression level the corresponding channel should have at runtime
        distributionPattern - the distribution patter according to which the subtasks of the connected vertices shall be connected
        allowSpanningRecords - true to allow spanning records for this edge, false otherwise. Spanning records are records which are too big to fit into one of Nephele's internal buffers at runtime. Allowing spanning records will instruct Nephele to split such records among multiple buffers, however, causes some memory copy overhead at runtime.
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex,
                      ChannelType channelType,
                      CompressionLevel compressionLevel,
                      int indexOfOutputGate,
                      int indexOfInputGate,
                      DistributionPattern distributionPattern)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        channelType - the channel type the two vertices should be connected by at runtime
        compressionLevel - the compression level the corresponding channel should have at runtime
        indexOfOutputGate - index of the producing task's output gate to be used, -1 will determine the next free index number
        indexOfInputGate - index of the consuming task's input gate to be used, -1 will determine the next free index number
        distributionPattern - the distribution patter according to which the subtasks of the connected vertices shall be connected
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(AbstractJobVertex vertex,
                      ChannelType channelType,
                      CompressionLevel compressionLevel,
                      int indexOfOutputGate,
                      int indexOfInputGate,
                      DistributionPattern distributionPattern,
                      boolean allowSpanningRecords)
               throws JobGraphDefinitionException
        Connects the job vertex to the specified job vertex.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex this vertex should connect to
        channelType - the channel type the two vertices should be connected by at runtime
        compressionLevel - the compression level the corresponding channel should have at runtime
        indexOfOutputGate - index of the producing task's output gate to be used, -1 will determine the next free index number
        indexOfInputGate - index of the consuming task's input gate to be used, -1 will determine the next free index number
        distributionPattern - the distribution patter according to which the subtasks of the connected vertices shall be connected
        allowSpanningRecords - true to allow spanning records for this edge, false otherwise. Spanning records are records which are too big to fit into one of Nephele's internal buffers at runtime. Allowing spanning records will instruct Nephele to split such records among multiple buffers, however, causes some memory copy overhead at runtime.
        Throws:
        JobGraphDefinitionException - thrown if the given vertex cannot be connected to vertex in the requested manner

        Throws:
